0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Constipation: 70% solution 2 to 3 tablespoonfuls (27 to 40 g sorbitol) ORALLY as a single daily dose
  • Constipation: 25% to 30% solution (1 part sorbitol 70% solution diluted with 2.3 parts water) 120 mL RECTALLY as a single daily dose
  • Irrigation of urinary bladder: 3% and 3.3% sorbitol IRRIGATION solution, volume should be guided by the duration and urologic procedure

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Constipation: age 12 years and older, 70% solution 2 to 3 tablespoonfuls (27 to 40 g sorbitol) ORALLY as a single daily dose
  • Constipation: age 12 years and older, 25% to 30% solution (1 part sorbitol 70% solution diluted with 2.3 parts water) 120 mL RECTALLY as a single daily dose
  • Constipation: age 2 years to under 12 years, 25% to 30% solution (1 part sorbitol 70% solution diluted with 2.3 parts water) 30 to 60 mL RECTALLY as a single daily dose

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Constipation
  • Irrigation of urinary bladder
  • Poisoning
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Dental caries; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• cardiopulmonary dysfunction, severe; monitoring recommended (irrigation)
  • continuous administration; risk of hypernatremia or water and electrolyte imbalances (irrigation)
  • diabetes mellitus; hyperglycemia may occur (irrigation)
  • fructose intolerance (irrigation)
  • gastrointestinal upset (ie, abdominal pain, nausea, or vomiting); may exacerbate (oral/rectal)
  • hyperosmolar states may develop in patients unable to efficiently metabolize sorbitol (irrigation)
  • hyponatremia; risk of exacerbation (irrigation)
  • inadequate hydration or hypovolemia; sustained diuresis may obscure and intensify (irrigation)
  • metabolically compromised; risk of significant lactic acidemia (irrigation)
  • renal dysfunction, severe; monitoring recommended (irrigation)
  • transurethral prostate resection; systemically absorbed fluid may lead to fulminating congestive heart failure; monitor cardiovascular status, especially in patients with cardiac disease (irrigation)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea, Vomiting
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Tachycardia
  • Endocrine metabolic:Acidosis, Disorder of electrolytes, Lactic acidosis
  • Gastrointestinal:Gastrointestinal necrosis, Colon
  • Neurologic:Seizure

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono:
• Sorbitol acts as an osmotic laxative agent when used as a 70% solution.
  • Sorbitol 3% or 3.3% irrigation solutions act as a lavage for removing blood and tissue fragments during urologic procedures.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    Sorbitol 3% or 3.3% irrigation solution is NOT for injection, use only for urologic irrigation
  • Intravesical
    • 3% solution: may be warmed in a water bath or oven to not more than 45 degrees C.
    • 3.3% solution in plastic irrigation containers: do not warm above 66 degrees C (150 degrees F)

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• (irrigation) fluid balance and electrolyte concentration changes, especially during prolonged procedures
  • (irrigation) cardiovascular status; before and during transurethral prostate resection; especially in cardiac disease patients

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause edema, dry mouth, thirst, and dehydration (urologic irrigation).
  • Drug may cause hyperglycemia (urologic irrigation). Instruct patients with diabetes to carefully monitor blood sugar levels and report worsening glucose control.
  • Drug may cause bloating, flatulence, nausea, vomiting, or cramping (oral or rectal solution).
  • Advise patient to discontinue use and immediately report rectal bleeding or failure to produce a bowel movement (oral or rectal solution).
